The height of the root node is 1, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 6.

The input graph is represented as a directed acyclic graph (DAG). The root node is 'n', and it has 7 edges leading to other nodes. The height of a node is the length of the longest path from that node to any leaf node. Therefore, the height of the root node is 1, because there is only one path from the root node to any leaf node.

The longest path from the root node to any leaf node includes all the edges leading to 'n', 'o', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x', 'y', 'z', 'ab', 'bb', 'cb', 'dc', 'ec', and 'zc'. Therefore, the number of edges in this path is 6.

The other nodes (e.g., 'o', 'p', 'q', etc.) are also represented as leaf nodes with height 0, because they have no edges leading to other nodes.
